com.github.noxan.blommagraphs.graphs

Interface TaskGraph

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultTaskGraph

    public interface TaskGraph
extends java.lang.Cloneable
    Generic interface for the task graph data structure.
    Author:
    noxan

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      returns an edge between two given nodes throws exception in case there is no edge between those nodes
      java.util.List<TaskGraphEdge> getCriticalPath()
      Returns the critical path (the path with takes the longest time to execute from first node to last node) of the graph as list of edges

      Returns the edge count of the complete task graph.

      Returns a set of all edges contained in the task graph.

      Returns the node (task) count of the complete task graph.

      Returns a set of all nodes (tasks) contained in the task graph.

        Returns:

      • insertNode

        TaskGraphNode insertNode(TaskGraphNode prevNode,
                       int prevCommunicationTime,
                       TaskGraphNode nextNode,
                       int nextCommunicationTime,
                       int computationTime)
        Adds a new node into the task graph and connecting it to a previous and next node. Makes sure the task graph itself stays valid and returns the created node.
        Parameters:
        prevNode - previous node
        prevCommunicationTime - communication time to the previous node
        nextNode - next node
        nextCommunicationTime - communication time to the next node
        computationTime - computation time of the new node
        Returns:
        the created node

      • insertNode

        TaskGraphNode insertNode(TaskGraphNode prevNode,
                       int prevCommunicationTime,
                       TaskGraphNode nextNode,
                       int nextCommunicationTime,
                       int computationTime,
                       boolean keepExistingEdge)
        Adds a new node into the task graph and connecting it to a previous and next node. Makes sure the task graph itself stays valid and returns the created node. This methods allows to keep an existing edge or connection between the previous and next node.
        Parameters:
        prevNode - previous node
        prevCommunicationTime - communication time to the previous node
        nextNode - next node
        nextCommunicationTime - communication time to the next node
        computationTime - computation time of the new node
        keepExistingEdge - if true the graph keeps and existing edge between next and previous node
        Returns:
        the created node
        See Also:
        insertNode

      • insertEdge

        TaskGraphEdge insertEdge(TaskGraphNode prevNode,
                       TaskGraphNode nextNode,
                       int communicationTime)
                         throws DuplicateEdgeException
        Adds a new edge between the previous and next node with a given communication time. Does not allow duplicate edges and loops.
        Parameters:
        prevNode - previous node
        nextNode - next node
        communicationTime - communication time for the new edge
        Returns:
        the created edge
        Throws:
        DuplicateEdgeException - thrown if an edge between those two nodes already exists

      • deleteEdge

        TaskGraphEdge deleteEdge(TaskGraphNode prevNode,
                       TaskGraphNode nextNode)
        Removes an edge between the two given nodes
        Parameters:
        prevNode - previous node
        nextNode - next node
        Returns:
        the deleted edge

              TaskGraphNode nextNode,
              int newCommunicationTime)
        Modifies the communication time between two nodes.
        Parameters:
        prevNode - previous node
        nextNode - next node
        newCommunicationTime - the new communication time

        Returns:

      • containsEdge

        boolean containsEdge(TaskGraphNode prevNode,
                   TaskGraphNode nextNode)
        Checks if there is a edge between the two given nodes.
        Parameters:
        prevNode - previous node
        nextNode - next node
        Returns:
        true if there is a edge between the two given nodes, else false

      • findEdge

        TaskGraphEdge findEdge(TaskGraphNode prevNode,
                     TaskGraphNode nextNode)
                       throws ContainsNoEdgeException
        returns an edge between two given nodes throws exception in case there is no edge between those nodes
        Parameters:
        prevNode - previous node
        nextNode - next node
        Returns:
        TaskGraphEdge if there is one, otherwise exception is thrown
        Throws:
        ContainsNoEdgeException

      • getMetaInformation

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getMetaInformation()
        Returns all the meta information related to this graph. Also contains the generator meta information if available. The returned map should be considered as immutable.
        Returns:
        meta information related to this graph

      • mergeGraph

        void mergeGraph(TaskGraph srcGraph,
              TaskGraphNode prevNode,
              int prevCommunicationTime,
              TaskGraphNode nextNode,
              int nextCommunicationTime)
        This method merges TaskGraph srcGraph into this instance of TaskGraph. All nodes and edges of srcGraph are inserted. Afterwards, additional edges are inserted to connect inserted nodes with the rest of the graph: one from this.prevNode -> srcGraph.firstNode and one from srcGraph.lastNode -> this.nextNode.
        Parameters:
        srcGraph - TaskGraph instance that is merged into this graph.
        prevNode - srcGraph is merged into this graph after prevNode.
        prevCommunicationTime - The communication time between this.prevNode -> srcGraph.firstNode.
        nextNode - The srcGraph is merged into this graph before nextNode.
        nextCommunicationTime - The communication time between srcGraph.lastNode -> this.nextNode.

      • clone

        TaskGraph clone()

      • setDeadline

        void setDeadline(int deadline)
        Resets the deadline of a graph to deadLine. That means that for all nodes in this graph TaskGraphNode.setDeadline(deadline) is called.
        Parameters:
        deadline - The new deadline of the graph.
